title: Introduction to Care Planning Policy
headline: This free online healthcare course explains how care plans protect the wellbeing and dignity of vulnerable patients.
description: Effective medical care requires a deep understanding of health concepts, care mapping and teamwork even among health professionals. A properly planned care policy ensures better patient care. This course unveils strategies for drawing up and implementing care plans in the UK. We also discuss specific ways that care plans safeguard the health of children and young people in the care plan. Sign up to learn how care planning improves patient care.
courseDescription:
Everyone wants to live a healthy life. This often requires access to instant medical intervention so individuals and groups must make concrete plans to achieve their health goals. This course introduces you to the care planning process using a learner-centred approach. We study care plan policies based on government guidelines and models of social care delivery in the UK. We highlight the roles of the multidisciplinary team drawing up and implementing care plans and establish the importance of the 'concept care map'.

The course then highlights the best approaches to effective care plan implementation. Learn how to evaluate a care plan considering parameters like self-management, team management and more. We discuss ways to maintain, retain and dispose of medical records. In addition, we review the UK's care planning policy and the role of the World Health Organization (WHO) in health and social planning in Europe.

We emphasise why you must safeguard children and young people by keeping them away from crime, antisocial behaviour and educational failure. The course examines various forms of child abuse and neglect and explains how to identify victims and seek help for them. Lastly, we examine government policies for safeguarding vulnerable children. Enrol in this course today to learn the details of care planning policies and enhance your ability to provide effective patient care.
